registrationmadness

Class Student

  • java.lang.Object
    • registrationmadness.Student
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Student
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A class to represent students in the registration simulation. Each student has an ID number, desired sections, alternate sections (the same courses as desired but in opposite times), preferred time (morning or afternoon), a course catalog, a list of rostered sections, and a list of waitlisted sections. The student also has the ability to find out if a class has open space, register for a class, and withdraw from a class, as well as register for a class from the waitlist.
    Version:
    Spring 2013
    Author:
    Michael McLaughlin, mvm@cis.upenn.edu

        Constructor for the student class. Passes to the student the below parameters:
        Parameters:
        desired - The student's desired sections.
        alternate - The student's alternate sections.
        mornings - The student's preferred section time.
        id - The student's ID number.
        allSections - The course catalog of all sections.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the student's section registration algorithm. Attempts to register the student in desired courses and then alternate courses, and then for any available section. Once the student has all three courses, they withdraw from any extant waitlits.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • desiredClasses

        public java.lang.String desiredClasses()
        Returns the list of the student's desired sections.
        Returns:
        The list of the student's desired sections.
